intro: Lithocardium tenuifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lithocardium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom during the cooler months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lithocardium tenuifolium is often found in coastal and inland desert environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
